intro: Sarcostemma hirtellum, commonly known as the hairy milkweed, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a hairy texture. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in spring, followed by follicles containing numerous seeds. It is often found in rocky or sandy habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Sarcostemma hirtellum is noted for its milky sap, which is toxic and can cause skin irritation.
